number of helpful: 79 of 94 people (84%) found this review helpful33 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 18, 2014
												It's an anomaly these days for a game to reel in such an emotional response in the player only to pull a bait-and-switch when you least expect it. I was kept at the edge of my boat seat from the moment the SEGA logo lured me in, I was ready. My heart was on the line along with the monster bass that swallowed my jig whole as he failed under the dock as guitars seemingly from heaven itself pounded away as did the giant fish. I turned rod leftIT'S COMING NEAR I turned rod right COME ON ALMOST THEREIn a brief moment of glory the monsterous bass was lifted on to my boat, seemingly putting it on the edge of capsizing. THIS ONE'S HUUUUUUUGE!I ranked in my tears and felt the bonus of time rush over me. Thank you Sega, thank you.

number of helpful: 25 of 28 people (89%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												Better fish AI than in CoD Ghost!Never owned the full game on the Dreamcast, but had the demo. I played that demo for hours. Now i finally got a chance to play the full game and it didn't disappoint.  Currently frustrated with the tournament mode. I do very well in the lodge area, but the bridge is brutal. The water in the bridge area is very deep, so you have to use sinking lures, if you don't reel the lure will just go to the bottom, if you lure fast the fish won't bite. This makes it very hard to catch anything in this area and just ends up costing me the tournament.  So be prepared to rage and scream at some stupid virtual fish to bite your f#%&ing lure!

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												That game you like? Yes, that one. The one that you sorted into favorites in your steam library. It's terrible and objectively so. Okay, that game's actually subjectively terrible, but only in the light of SEGA Bass Fishing™. SEGA Bass Fishing™ has lore so deep and replayability so seemless that I am literally dumbfounded by the now gleaming short comings of every other game ever created. Like Atari games of old, anything played after SEGA Bass Fishing™ will now appear as a waste of time and a thing of the past. Which was wasted. Because like, it was time you spent playing something other than  SEGA Bass Fishing™.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2012
												Classic Sega game.  But it's instantly clear that this game was made for arcades. The timer adds a little challenge but since you can continue your game with the press of a button after the timer has run out there's no point in having it there to begin with. They should've removed it completely, or should've made a different mode for it for those people who do actually enjoy it.. Then again, console ports weren't treated the same as they are treated these days so I willjust forgive them ;)And besides, the port isn't really all that poor, it still holds up but the control scheme is also classic Sega and makes absolutely no sense. But, it's playable with a little practice.If you're a fishing fan, you basically have no other choice. There aren't that many fishing games out there. But Sega Bass Fishing would be a solid choice.

Posted: December 12, 2014
												Man this game brings me back to the days when I was a kid and the entramce to walmart was a cool place to check out! Got this game as part of the Dreamcast collection in a bundle for $1 and this game alone made it worth it seeing as I probably spent more than $20 on it as a kid.But the game has the  Original mode which has the tournaments and other modes like practice fishing and then it has the arcade mode that puts me right in the nostaliga of growing up in the 90s and early 00s without having to a spend a buck every coupe of minutes. This game is just clean fun looks the same as it did and how it should considering its a game from the 90s I play on a game pad and the controls are easy but the game still has enough of a challenge to make you want to play it though it can and does get boring after a while I would say it would be a fun game to play for you and a younger kid even if you don't really like fishing this game is still enjoyable.

												Think fishing is boring? Think again.You probably got this game just by buying the Dreamcast Collection and never tried it, but maybe you should! number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												Nostalgia shades on! I remember sinking so many hours (and lures) in this game when I was younger, and this is definitely a very good port of the original Dreamcast version, but admittedly I was used to playing an earlier PC port so the Dreamcast controls felt a bit off.Okay. You fish. For bass. Sounds boring, right? Wrong. This game holds up so well and has definitely stood the test of time. I have tried other fishing games but none have ever captured the original magic. Graphics... who cares? It still looks pretty good even by today's standards. And then there's the music. All the original tracks are there and it was like the ultimate blast from the past.... Surprisingly, I haven't lost my knack for a game I haven't played in several years. So... that's something?Normally I try to write a balanced review and try to find something I can complain about, but... I can't on this occasion. Simple premise, great execution, great soundtrack... okay, maybe one thing. A few extra game modes would have been nice, such as a challenge mode, but that's hardly a real gripe when this is reliving the nostalgia of my childhood.Love fishing? Go for it. Even if you don't, at least you don't have to contend with real-world weather to haul in your big catch.One final note... it's gonna be a BIIIIIIIIG ONE.LOWER THE ROD!

content:
Posted: October 1, 2011
												A wonderful fishing game that really brings you back to the Dreamcast system. The controls are the only obstacle of this game. The gameplay is awesome because you can catch a fish every-time casting out. It has a single player campaign that lets you catch alot of fish for the Tournament standings. There are really big fish and little ones to be caught but all will be a challenge if you dont know how to handle the reel right. The graphics are great for this type of game. It puts you in control of everything and lets you see into the water to catch the fish you want. The music in game is old school and fun. The overall game is great and if your into fishing this is a must buy when seeing it on sale. Ive loved playing it in my spare time and I know you will too.

												A ten year old trolling simulator. Playing this game is on the same level as a madden game from a decade ago. It does nothing unique and kind of feels pointless, I can only recommend this game to the very small number of people who regard this game in high nostalgic esteem. Fishing is a minigame and should be an aside for games like Breath of Fire 4 or Sonic Adventure, the latter of which is a magnificent example of a game from that time period that still holds up.

												"Just as exciting as real fishing! So basically, terrible." 5/10I imagine this game is a lot like fishing while sober. And that's not a good thing. I don't even want to go fishing when I'm drunk, let alone when I'm sober, so you can imagine how I feel about this gem. It's almost as if the creators of this old Dreamcast game wanted to see if they could actually make fishing less exciting than it already is. Well, if that was their goal then they succeeded with flying colors. At least with real fishing you have the satisfaction of wrestling and eventually catching a real live fish. But here? It's barely a challenge at all. And wrestling with a 360 controller or keyboard looks awfully stupid. And I'm not sure about any of you, but I've gone fishing a few times, and it sure as heck wasn't easy.I know a lot of people here have strong feelings for this game dating back to their formative years when the Sega Dreamcast was the best thing ever invented. And that's all fine and dandy. God knows I love a lot of terrible games simply because they bring back fond memories of days since forgotten. But I never played this game when I was a child, so I don't share the same feelings for this steaming pile of nostalgia. Pick your lure, cast your line, and catch a fish, that's really all there is to this game. And I know that's what it's supposed to be, being a fishing game and all, but I mean, come on, give me a little more of a challenge.Okay, well, I guess I could see this being somewhat fun in the arcade with a fake fishing pole and an artificial reel and whatnot. But on the Dreamcast or with a 360 controller or keyboard, this game is just terrible. You may get a glimmer of fun out of it when you reel in that first fish of yours, but shortly after that you'll be shutting it off for something more challenging. And I dare you to make it to the end of the 'regular mode', because it's painfully long and repetitive. The only redeeming quality about this game is when the announcer yells out 'Fish!' when you first catch one, much like the announcer in 'Mortal Kombat' yells 'Fight!' before every match.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												Could be one of the worst games ever.  There is no way to adjust the sound or mute the hokey Japanese accent voice over.  There are limited things which you can do.  These include: turn your rod left, turn your rod right, reel in slow, reel in normal, reel in fast, and of course, cast.  Maps are limited to four different areas on the same lake.  You can choose from a very limited number of lures; six to start with, a handful more later (which are simply different paint jobs on the originals), and as far as I can determine, you only have one rod to choose from.  Oh yes, and you can also determine which time of day you want to go fishing: morning, noon, or evening.  The time of day seems to make very little difference as far as I can tell.  This game would be far to expensive if it were free, but the $8.95 which this game costs is the equivalent of being skinned and gutted alive.  It's not even humane enough for a fish.  The only positive thing about this game is that your hands don't get stinky.  But SEGA sure stink up the place by charging money for this game.

Posted: September 9, 2015
												This is by far the most riveting game i have ever played, the gameplay drags you in like the jesus from hell and will chain you down and suck your life away, you will have so many emotions rushing through you, your life will go by so fast while you're being taken by the curse of this game."What curse?" you may ask yourself, well let me tell you chump, buckle your pants and listen.This game is so good, it will ruin your social life because all you do through out the day is play this game.And you may think is a good game really a curse? Well listen.It is not, but this game is not good, infact this game is so fantastic it had absolutely no purpose to excist in such a mentally weak world.So now you ask, you little weak minded person somewhere in the world will ask yourself: "Well why is he recommending and praising this game then?"Well the answer is simple, this game is so fantastic everyone needs to own this game.This game is so fantastic everyone needs to play this game.This game is so fantastic everyone needs to make passionate love to this game.And that when it all falls apart, when you realize this is but a digital copy and making love to such is not possible.And after you realize this cruel fate, this cruel truth... you will cry, you will sob, you will consider suicide, but let me tell you, it is not worth it, because even if you cannot make love to this game, you can always play it, and play  it, and play it, and play it, and play it, and play it, and play it, and play it, and play it......untill......the day that you have been waiting comes......the day this game will not work anymrore, the day you have played the game su much, the digital copy is broken. That my child, is the day you have been freed from the curse of SEGA Bass Fishing, the day, you can get your life back together once again. Thank you, and happy fishing young child.

												Well, this fishing game is actually quite good (for a fishing game of course). You get to catch bass! There are just few lone game modes, mostly you'd be playing Arcade I'd guess. The Championship mode is a neat one, too. There you compete with others (those "others" are only on leaderboards though). Who catches the most fish (mass-wise) wins. Better off training in Arcade before going for that.The game is old, yes, but you still can have tons of fun if you're into these kind of games even a bit!Lil' Sucky Gameplay to go with the review.

												Having originally played this game on the Dreamcast, I can safely say it is a faithful port and is just as engaging. This game can be mildly addictive due to driving the player to want to do better.  Arcade mode is easy to clear, but the Tornament Series and bonus lures add to the replay value, as do the extra locations in practice mode.Keyboard controls are absolutely fine, once you remember what each button does. They cannot be altered, but are comfortable enough to master, so they may not need to be.  No crashing or issues with saving yet. Only downside: imperial measurements cannot be altred to display in metric; get with the times, developers!All in all, recommended, especially for players who like a challenge and who strive to do better. This is coming from someone who until now, has not taken an interest in real-life angling. Worth the discounted £2.79!
